# XYZ Momentum Index Methodology

## 1. Overview

The XYZ Momentum Index tracks the performance of high-momentum stocks in the US equity market. The index is rebalanced quarterly according to the procedures outlined in Appendix A: Rebalancing Procedures.

## 2. Universe Selection

The eligible universe consists of all stocks listed on NYSE and NASDAQ that meet the liquidity criteria defined in our Corporate Governance Policy Document (CGP-2024-001).

## 3. Index Calculation

The index level is calculated using the methodology specified in the Master Index Calculation Framework (MICF-v3.2). The base date is January 1, 2020 with a base value of 1000.

For corporate action adjustments, please refer to the Corporate Actions Handling Manual.

## 4. Data Sources

Stock prices are sourced from the Primary Data Vendor as per the Data Services Agreement. Real-time prices are available via the vendor's proprietary API.

## 5. Rebalancing

Quarterly rebalancing occurs on the third Friday of March, June, September, and December. The specific rebalancing procedures are detailed in Appendix A.

Buffer rules for additions and deletions follow the thresholds established in the Index Committee Charter.

## 6. Governance

All methodology changes must be approved by the Index Committee according to the procedures in the Governance Framework Document (GFD-2023).

## 7. Contact

For questions, contact the Index Management Team.
